cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles north of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then turning NW toward the Florida Keys and South Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet and north of Bonita Beach to Venice
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast, including Port Everglades, the Florida Keys, and portions of the southwest Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possibly Category 4 strength) with gusts over 100 mph likely at Port Everglades late Saturday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 5–10 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast, including Port Everglades, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible, producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; possible coastal erosion.
